citeinfo.title: Digital Offshore Cadastre (DOC) - Pacific83 - Official Protraction Diagram (OPD) Outlines

pubinfo.publish: Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Geospatial Services Division

citeinfo.title: Technical Information Management System (TIMS), Mapping System, Block and Boundary Component

pubinfo.publish: Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch

descript.abstract: This data set contains Official Protraction Diagram (OPD) outlines in ESRI Arc/Info export and Arc/View shape file formats for the BOEM Pacific Region. The use of OPD s makes it easier to refer to individual blocks within a region or planning area. Further information on the historic development of OPD s can be found in OCS Report BOEM 99-0006: Boundary Development on the Outer Continental Shelf. Because GIS projection and topology functions can change or generalize coordinates, these GIS files are NOT an OFFICIAL record for the exact OPD boundaries. Only the paper OPD or a digital image of them serve as OFFICIAL records.
descript.purpose: Official Protraction Diagrams and other cadastre information the BOEM produces are generated in accordance with 30 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR)556.8 subpart A (formerly CFR 30 256.8 subpart A (2010)) to support Federal land ownership and mineral resource management.
descript.supplinf: The BOEM is making its existing cadastre data available at https://www.boem.gov/Oil-and-Gas-Energy-Program/Mapping-and-Data/Index.aspx and on CD-ROM. These data will include digital images of BOEM data at the regional, planning area, Official Protraction Diagram (OPD), and Supplemental Official OCS Block Diagram (SOBD) levels and digital spatial data in Arc/Info export or Arc/View shape format at the regional or planning area levels.

dataqual.logic: Coordinates for OCS blocks and projected boundaries are calculated quantities and have been defined to be correct to 3 decimal places of a meter. The OPD polygon coverage was topologically cleaned with Arc/Info s CLEAN command using a fuzzy tolerance of 0.000002 applied to the coverage in longitude/latitude coordinates.
dataqual.complete: All NAD83 Federal Pacific Ocean offshore protraction diagram (OPD) boundaries are shown.

horizpa.horizpar: Official protraction diagram (OPD) corners are calculated values to 3 decimal places of a meter. However, GIS functions which build topology, change projection, etc. may degrade coordinate values. For that reason, these GIS files are NOT an OFFICIAL record.

citeinfo.origin: Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Geospatial Services Division
citeinfo.title: TIMS, Mapping Syetem, Block and Boundary Component

pubinfo.publish: Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch

srcinfo.srccontr: Coordinates of the protraction diagram corners were taken from TIMS.

procstep.procdesc: The source data for the OCS protraction diagram coverage (OPD) is a theoretical mathematical derivation. In-house computer programs are used to generate the boundaries for each diagram.

cntorgp.cntorg: Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch

overview.eaover: The shape files contain the following entities: Shape: Polygon Area: Size of polygon in ESRI coverage units Perimeter: Perimeter of polygon in ESRI coverage units Protrac_: Internal ESRI number Protrac_id: Internal ESRI number BOEM_region: BOEM region code (P = Pacific) Prot_numbe: BOEM OPD identification number Prot_aprv: BOEM OPD approval date (day-month-year) Prot_name: BOEM OPD/map name Proj_zone: OPD UTM map projection zone code (9 = 132W to 126W longitude, 10 = 126W to 120W longitude, 11 = 120W to 114W longitude)

cntorgp.cntorg: Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch

distinfo.distliab: As is. No responsibility is assumed for the correctness of this data.
